warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend your arms out to the sides and make small circles, gradually increasing the size. Perform 2 sets of 30 seconds each direction.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Get on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Alternate between arching your back (cat) and dropping your belly (cow). Perform 2 sets of 10 reps.
Swing your arms out to the sides and then cross them in front of your chest. Perform 2 sets of 15 reps.

exercises.setup: Sit down at a lat pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad to fit snugly against your thighs.
execution: Grip the bar with a wide grip, palms facing forward.
Pull the bar down to your upper chest while keeping your back straight.
Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement.
Slowly return to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Sit at the lat pull-down machine with a neutral grip attachment.
alternative_exercise_execution: Grip the attachment with palms facing each other.
Pull the bar down to your upper chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom.
Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows for 10 reps with proper form, similar to the wide grip version.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on engaging your back muscles rather than pulling with your arms.

exercises.setup: Use a preacher bench to angle your upper arm.
execution: Sit at the preacher bench with your upper arms resting on the pad.
Grip the barbell or dumbbell with an underhand grip.
Curl the weight up towards your shoulders, keeping your upper arms stationary.
Lower the weight slowly back to the starting position, maintaining tension in your biceps.
exercises.weight: Use a weight that allows you to perform 10 reps with control, focusing on the stretch and contraction.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Adjust the seat height so your upper arms rest comfortably on the pad.
alternative_exercise_execution: Grip the machine handles with an underhand grip.
Curl the handles towards your shoulders, keeping your upper arms stationary.
Lower the handles slowly back to the starting position.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that enables you to complete 10 reps with good form, similar to the free weight version.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on squeezing your biceps at the top of the movement for maximum contraction.

exercises.setup: Sit down at a lat pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad to fit snugly against your thighs.
execution: Grip the bar with a wide grip, palms facing forward.
Pull the bar down to your upper chest while keeping your back straight.
Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement.
Slowly return to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
exercises.weight: Maintain the same weight as the first set to ensure consistency and focus on form.

Slowly return to the starting position.
